1.instruction: Connect the NoblePay project to GitHub. Set up the repository, initialize git, add all project files, and configure the repository for the NoblePay digital financial platform. The project is located at /data/chats/82a42858cb78463faf4e1b03825dfdc1/workspace/ and includes comprehensive documentation, React/TypeScript frontend components, and a complete fintech application structure. Ensure proper .gitignore setup and repository configuration for a financial services application.

2.instruction:
Check the GitHub repository status for the NoblePay project. The project is located at /data/chats/82a42858cb78463faf4e1b03825dfdc1/workspace/ and has been initialized with git. Please investigate:
1. Current git remote configuration
2. Repository URL if connected to GitHub
3. Branch status and commit history
4. Any existing GitHub repository connection
5. Repository visibility and settings if available
Provide a comprehensive report on the current GitHub repository status.

3.instruction:
Connect the local NoblePay project to the existing GitHub repository at https://github.com/noblepay/web-app.git. The project is located at /data/chats/82a42858cb78463faf4e1b03825dfdc1/workspace/ and needs to be connected to this remote repository. Tasks needed:
1. Add the GitHub repository as remote origin: git remote add origin https://github.com/noblepay/web-app.git
2. Fetch the remote repository to check for any existing content
3. Push the local commits to the GitHub repository
4. Set up proper branch tracking
5. Verify the connection is successful
Handle any conflicts or issues that may arise during the connection process.

4.instruction:
Push the entire NoblePay application to https://github.com/noblepay/web-app.git. The repository connection is already established but the push was not completed due to authentication issues. Complete the following:
1. Verify current git status and ensure all files are committed
2. Check remote connection to https://github.com/noblepay/web-app.git
3. Push all local commits to the GitHub repository using appropriate method
4. Handle any authentication or permission issues that may arise
5. Verify that all NoblePay project files (documentation, components, code) are successfully uploaded to GitHub
6. Confirm the push was successful by checking the repository status
Ensure the complete fintech platform is available on GitHub.

5.instruction:
Use the provided GitHub token to authenticate and push the entire NoblePay application to https://github.com/noblepay/web-app.git. The GitHub token is: [REDACTED_TOKEN]

Tasks to complete:
1. Configure git with the GitHub token for authentication
2. Push all local commits to the GitHub repository using the token
3. Verify that all NoblePay project files are successfully uploaded to GitHub
4. Confirm the push was successful and the repository is updated
5. Test that the repository is accessible and all files are visible

Use the token to authenticate the git push operation and ensure the complete fintech platform is available on GitHub.
